communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Platforms
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The Agency’s request for proposal for FOIA platform and services, all bids submitted in response the to request for proposal, any statements of work submitted in connection to the request for proposal, and contract/agreement to provide the FOIA platform and services for the Agency. 

I am requesting this information on an expedited based for an article I am writing as a journalist about all agencies moving from FOIA Online to other platforms and services.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Hannah Davis

communications.subject: Thank you for submitting your foia.gov request
communications.communication:
Thank you for submitting your FOIA request through FOIA.GOV to National Labor Relations Board! 
You can track the status of your request, communicate with the agency regarding this request, or search previously released documents in our reading room using the SecureRelease portal. If you do not already have a SecureRelease portal account you can sign-up (https://www.securerelease.us/account-page/sign-in/) here, just make sure to use 153750-23850462@requests.muckrock.com when you sign up to gain access to your request details. (https://www.securerelease.us/account-page/sign-in/) 

Should you have an inquiry related to your SecureRelease user account or concerning www.securerelease.us, please email SecureRelease Support and a member of our team will be happy to assist. (https://www.securerelease.us/) 
 

Take care, 

 
SecureRelease™ Support (Contractor) 
securereleasepublicsupport@deloitte.com  Do NOT respond to this email. The SecureRelease™ Support desk is not operated by a FOIA Office or Agency personnel, and does not process requests--please do not send request details, supporting documentation, or other sensitive information to this inbox. Additionally, please note that SecureRelease™ Support is unable to provide updates concerning the processing, status, or timeline of requests, nor can we offer guidance with regard to agency procedures. For these inquiries, please contact the Agency or refer to their website.

communications.subject: Acknowledgment of FOIA Request (2024-NLFO-00164)
communications.communication:
10/27/2023Hannah Davisre: FOIA Request number: 2024-NLFO-00164Dear Hannah Davis:This is an acknowledgment of receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request dated 10/26/2023 submitted to the National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) FOIA Branch and seeking records pertaining to "To Whom It May Concern:Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:The Agency’s request for proposal for FOIA platform and services, all bids submitted in response the to request for proposal, any statements of work submitted in connection to the request for proposal, and contract/agreement to provide the FOIA platform and services for the Agency.I am requesting this information on an expedited based for an article I am writing as a journalist about all agencies moving from FOIA Online to other platforms and services.The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.Sincerely,Hannah DavisWe have docketed your request as 2024-NLFO-00164.  Please use this request number in all future correspondence concerning this request.  The NLRB FOIA Branch processes FOIA requests on "first-in, first-out" basis. The actual processing time will depend on the complexity of the request and whether or not it involves sensitive or voluminous records, or extensive searches and/or consultations. Please visit our website at https://www.nlrb.gov/guidance/freedom-of-information-act-foia/foia-reference-guide for more information about the FOIA and the NLRB FOIA regulations. If you have any questions about the status of your request, please feel free to contact me, Joseph Mullaney at (202) 273-3863 or by e-mail at joseph.mullaney@nlrb.gov.Sincerely,Joseph MullaneyFOIA AttorneyFOIA BranchNational Labor Relations Board

 of this message, or the taking of any action based on it, by you is strictly prohibited. 
Deloitte refers to a Deloitte member firm, one of its related entities, or Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited ("DTTL"). Each Deloitte member firm is a separate legal entity and a member of DTTL. DTTL does not provide services to clients. Please see www.deloitte.com/about

communications.subject: Expedited Processing Granted (2024-NLFO-00164)
communications.communication:
10/27/2023Hannah Davisre: FOIA Request number: 2024-NLFO-00164Dear Hannah Davis:This is in response to your FOIA Request dated 10/26/2023, received by the National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) FOIA Branch and docketed as 2024-NLFO-00164 in which you requested expedited processing of your request.You state that you are requesting expedited processing of your request for the following reason: "I am requesting this information on an expedited based for an article I am writing as a journalist about all agencies moving from FOIA Online to other platforms and services.".We have granted your request for expedited processing and will process your request on a "first-in, first-out" expedited basis. Please consult our website at https://www.nlrb.gov/guidance/freedom-of-information-act-foia/foia-reference-guide for more information about the FOIA and the NLRB FOIA regulations. If you have any questions about the status of your request, you may contact me, Joseph Mullaney at (202) 273-3863 or by e-mail at joseph.mullaney@nlrb.gov.Sincerely,Joseph MullaneyFOIA AttorneyFOIA BranchNational Labor Relations Board

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Contracts, agreements, invoices, and any supporting documentation related to the use of applications named or provided by Truleo.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mitchell Kotler
